sentence: The major averages were all sharply higher on Monday as a rally in oil and the outcome of the latest presidential debate drove the Dow Jones Industrial Average to a two-week high.
All eleven sectors of the S&P 500 were in the green with the energy sector out in front, while only eight of the 30 Dow component stocks were negative.
The Nasdaq Composite earlier flirted with its record high before retreating slightly, led by gains in the biotech and computer hardware sectors.

Oil was fueling most of today's uptrade with West Texas Intermediate more than 3% higher in reaction to remarks from Russian President Vladimir Putin supportive of production cuts proposed by the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries.

Speaking at the World Energy Congress in Istanbul Monday, Putin said "we support the recent initiative of OPEC to fix oil production limits....and hope the idea will be embedded at the OPEC meeting in November."

Stocks were also getting a lift from last night's presidential debate between Republican candidate Donald Trump and Democratic candidate Hillary Clinton as Wall Street seems more at ease with the more defined economic policies of front-runner Clinton than the uncertainty surrounding Trump.
European bourses are also higher with Italy's Borsa Italiana outperforming on better-than-expected Italian industrial production.
Additionally, German exports posted their biggest gain in six years, contributing to a 1.27% rise in the DAX.
Gains in mining and oil stocks drove the UK FTSE-100 to its highest close in more than a year.
Crude oil was up $1.42 to $51.23 per barrel.
Natural gas was up $0.07 to $3.27 per 1 million BTU.
Gold was up $9.40 to $1,261.20 an ounce, while silver was up $0.28 to $17.67 an ounce.
Copper was up $0.03 to $2.19 per pound.
Among energy ETFs, the United States Oil Fund was up 3.22% to $11.70 with the United States Natural Gas Fund up 2.79% to $9.38.
Among precious-metal funds, the Market Vectors Gold Miners ETF was up 1.13% to 23.28 while SPDR Gold Shares were up 0.34% to $120.14.
The iShares Silver Trust was up 1.04% to $16.78.

Here's where the markets stand at mid-day:

NYSE Composite Index was up 71.06 points (+0.66%) to 10,697.23

Dow Jones Industrial Index was up 121.87 points (+0.67%) to 18,362.26

S&P 500 was up 13.27 points (+0.60%) to 2,166.42

Nasdaq Composite Index was up 42.77 points (+0.81%) to 5,335.18

FTSE 100 was up 53.11 points (+0.75%) to 7,097.50

DAX was up 133.22 points (+1.27%) to 10,624.08

CAC 40 was up 47.35 points (+1.06%) to 4,497.26

Shanghai China Composite Index was up 43.44 (+1.45%) to 3,048.14

NYSE Energy Sector Index was up 200.93 points (+1.86%) to 11,061.90

NYSE Financial Sector Index was up 38.53 points (+0.63%) to 6,261.48

NYSE Healthcare Sector Index was up 60.17 points (+0.48%) to 12,528.22
